issues.description: The solution's Farm class provides only a constructor with an int parameter (`public Farm(int initialCapacity)`), but the problem statement explicitly instructs to initialize the ArrayList in a no-argument constructor (and the template and Main use `new Farm()` with no arguments). Students will be unable to instantiate Farm as specified, causing compile errors and test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a public no-argument constructor (`public Farm()`) in Farm that initializes `animals = new ArrayList<>()`, or overload the constructor so that `new Farm()` works as described in the problem statement.

issues.description: In the template, `singFarmSongVerse` is declared without any parameters (`private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/)`), but both the UML in the problem statement and the solution implementation define it as taking an `Animal` parameter. This mismatch will confuse students and prevent correct invocation of the method when implementing `singFarmSong()`.
issues.suggested_fix: In the template, change the method signature to `private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)` to match the specification and solution.
